info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-tunnel-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions for
     Tunnel domains and interfaces.
     Copyright (c) 2018-2020, 2022, 2025 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** VPN & Tunnels
**Paths:** 13

get.description: Top-level container for tunnel operational data
List of tunnel domains, keyed by domain name and type (collection)
List of tunnel domains, keyed by domain name and type
List of tunnel domains, keyed by domain name and type (collection)
List of tunnel domains, keyed by domain name and type

name.description: The name of the Tunnel interface.

up-timestamp.description: Last time this gateway went up

in-octets.description:
The total number of octets received on the interface,
         including framing characters.

in-unicast-pkts.description:
The total number of unicast packets received on the
         interface.

in-broadcast-pkts.description:
The total number of broadcast packets received on the
         interface.

in-multicast-pkts.description:
The total number of multicast packets received on the
         interface.

in-discards.description:
The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be
         discarded even though no errors.

in-errors.description:
The number of inbound packets that contained errors
         preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer
         protocol.

out-octets.description:
The total number of octets transmitted out of the
         interface.

out-unicast-pkts.description:
The total number of unicast packets that higher-level
         protocols requested be transmitted.

out-broadcast-pkts.description:
The total number of broadcast packets that higher-level
         protocols requested be transmitted.

out-multicast-pkts.description:
The total number of broadcast packets that higher-level
         protocols requested be transmitted.

out-discards.description:
The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be
         discarded even though no errors had been detected to
         prevent their being transmitted.

out-errors.description:
The number of outbound packets that could not be
         transmitted because of errors.

rx-pps.description: The receive packet per second rate on this interface

rx-kbps.description: The receive kilobits per second rate on this interface

tx-pps.description: The transmit packet per second rate on this interface

tx-kbps.description: The transmit kilobits per second rate on this interface

         discarded even though no errors had been detected to
         prevent their being transmitted.

         transmitted because of errors.

rx-pps.description: The receive packet per second rate on this interface

rx-kbps.description: The receive kilobits per second rate on this interface

tx-pps.description: The transmit packet per second rate on this interface

tx-kbps.description: The transmit kilobits per second rate on this interface

mode.description: The mode of the Tunnel interface.

intf-vrf.description:
VRF to which this interface belongs to. If the
         interface is not in a VRF then it is 'Global'.

transport-vrf.description:
Transport VRF. If this
         is not mentioned, then it is 'Global'

ipsec-profile.description: The IPSEC profile attached to a tunnel interface

items.description:
A list of the IPv6 addresses associated with the interface.
         This contains all the IPv6 addresses, including the link local
         addresses, assigned to the interface
